boardgame.name: Super Chicken Catchers
boardgame.description:
Super Chicken Catchers is a 2v2 future sport with chickens, aliens, and flying pigs, where professional chicken-catchers compete for the galaxy's ultimate prize. It's Year 2 of Era 4 on Planet 12, which can only mean one thing... it's time for the galaxy-wide Cluckball Championship!

As the entire galaxy watches, you and your fellow Twelvians will battle for the ultimate 2v2 sporting prize. But with the competition so fierce, you and your partner will need to hone your co-operative tactics to become champions of the stars.

How will you collaborate? What's your game plan? Will you outwit your opponents and emerge victorious, as the team in possession of the fabled chicken?

Features


Unique coop game mechanics
A mount and a rider, both having completely opposite but yet complementary abilities. Will you play like the famously fast piggy or like the flying daredevil rider?
PLAY with your friends, up to 4 players in a local split-screen mode
PLAY online with your friends or against other players
Colorful arenas, each with their own special features.
Cosmetic customization items, because a chief’s hat just fits perfectly on chain mail.
Free content updates will be released after launch
No harmed chickens during the creation of this game


Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: Super Steampunk Pinball 2D
boardgame.description:
Pinball game with many levels and pass-and-play option.

User Summary

boardgame.name: Sure Footing
boardgame.description:
Sure Footing is a fast and frantic infinite runner about four friends saving their world from extinction. The world of Computra is under threat from the evil Ramrafstar and his ferocious minion Deletion Dave, who seek to destroy the partitions that hold everything together.

Play as one of our four heroes: Pixel Pete, Polly Polygon, Blip and Plunk as they outrun Dave across the disk sectors of Computra: to warn their friends and find a way to stop Ramrafstar before their home world is destroyed. Collect MIPs, avoid obstacles and overcome the challenges faced in the distant sectors of Computra.Four Playable Characters: Play as Pixel Pete, Polly Polygon, Blip and Plunk – each with their own strengths and weaknesses.


Visit distant sectors of the world of Computra: Watch out for the weird and wonderful changes these distant sectors bring.
Customise Your Loadout: Play it your way with a variety of power-ups and buffs that can give you an edge over Deletion Dave.
In-Game Shop: Collect MIPs in-game to unlock customisation options, with over 100 items to unlock! New power-ups, skill buffs and extra costumes for each character.
In-Game Challenges: Complete in-game challenges to build successfully unlock new content.
Play At Your Own Speed: Finding the game too taxing? Or simply not hard enough? No problem! Our procedural generation system is designed to tailor itself towards a variety of difficulty settings that allow you to play the game at your own pace.
Leaderboards and Player Stats: See how you compare up against the rest of the Sure Footing community.
Single and Multiplayer Challenge Modes: Play challenge levels for two to four players and show your friends how to keep running!
Sure Footing blends the best of both classic platforming and infinite runners into a fast and frantic arcade experience.


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: THE TEAR
boardgame.description:
This interactive fantasy XR world is based on the universal motif of the magic mountain as gate to The Otherworld.

... Go out and marvel at this world of wonders with the eyes of a child. And after a long and wondrous journey, fantastical creatures might grant you admittance to another dimension only a pure heart might be able to withstand.

Who looks outside, dreams. Who looks inside, awakes.

More than 'just a game'. It incorporates YOU, your voice, your image, your behavior and takes you on a journey to your inner self. Save both,the magic world and the world outside your HMD!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Temple of Xiala
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Puzzle game where you have to move blocks in order to clear the different levels.User Summary

boardgame.name: Tross
boardgame.description:
Fly through the digital software Tross to save it against hacking attempts.

User Summary

boardgame.name: The Window Box
boardgame.description:
For what is a house but a box with windows?

The Window Box is a whimsical dark comedy visual novel about a group of friends trapped in a house during a freak storm. Wander from room to room as a fly on the wall, while helping the women confront the conflict in their lives.

Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: A Witchy Life Story
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





A Witchy Life Story is a narrative witchcraft and gardening sim. You play as a witch-who-might-get-kicked-out-of-training, as you grow flowers and craft potions to help the local villagers sort out their lives. It’s Little Witch Academia meets #cottagecore in this heartwarming and humorous game!Key Features


Design your own witch and dress them in late 60’s/early 70’s fashion!
Tend to a variety of plants and use them to craft 24 different spells.
Befriend six villagers or not. Help the Floralia Festival succeed or not. Your choice!
Decorate your personal alter with your favorite crystals, tarot cards, and flowers.
Perform affirmations, divinations, incantations and more!


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Zero G Arena
boardgame.description:
In space . . . No-one can votekick you for getting outrageously sicknasty midair railgun kills.

Zero G Arena is finally bringing ragdoll physics to a deadly new forefront. Cartwheel, swing and slide through 3D battlegrounds at speeds that are quite literally, out of this world.

Master total freedom of movement in 3-dimensions and your friends will never know what fragged them.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Scourge of the Seas
boardgame.description:
Ahoy captains!

Scourge of the Seas is a card-based game for 2-6 players of age 9+.

Draw from the Land deck to visit taverns in search of pirates to join your crew, then set sail and fight the enemy ships and sea forts you find in the Caribbean Sea deck to grab loot and gain fame.

But beware: terrible creatures lurk in the depths, waiting for reckless captains to get too close...
If things start to go South, make sure to go back on land to fix your ship before it sinks!

The first player to become famous wins... Who will become the Scourge of the Seas?

And remember: You can’t blame Poseidon if you sink... Twice.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Reaching Moon Megacorp's Life of Moonson, Book One: The Characters
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Reaching Moon Megacorp's Life of Moonson Book One: The Characters contains fifty illustrated character sheets from the freeform live-action role-playing game (LARP) run at North American, British and Australian Gloranthan Conventions in the late nineties.

Take part in the Lunar New Year Ceremonies! Marvel at the glory and decadence of the Imperial Court! Witness the majesty of the Senate, the might of the Red Army, and the sinister machinations of the organs of state...

boardgame.name: Clash of Deck N°3
boardgame.description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the second expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. A new game mechanic makes its appearance: the cards which rotate on themselves. You will also be able to discover three new special abilities that will add even more combos and depth to your games: Revive, Second Wind and Leap!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: HERO: Quest For the Most Heroic
boardgame.description:
HERO: Quest for the most heroic.

In HERO, players take the roles of adventurers who embarked on a quest to become a hero of The Land of Lacuna. Lacuna is a rugged land filled with opportunity, a brave adventurer can prove themselves by completing quests, defeating foes, from goblins to fearsome ogres, farming cattle, fishing, trading, sinking pirate ships and more. Each player assembles and equips their own army, hiring various warriors from archers to knights to the powerful wizard. All of them have one goal in mind: to become the most heroic!

HERO is a deck-building board game. Each player starts with the same combination of cards – this is your deck. You then use the cards to move your army, fight battles, complete tasks and to purchase new and better cards. These new cards are added to your deck to improve it, allowing you to adventure further, and face tougher foes.

The game ends when the last 'Event' card has been completed, all players add up their acquired tokens to find out who is the most heroic.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: L.A.M.A.: Drama
L.A.M.A.: L.A.C.H.E.N.
boardgame.description:
L.A.M.A.: Drama is a print-and-play mini-expansion for L.L.A.M.A..

To setup, place the L.A.M.A. DRAMA tile in the middle of the table. When a player plays a L.A.M.A. card, they place one of their lowest chips onto the L.A.M.A. DRAMA tile (If the player does not have any chips, nothing happens).

When a player places the fifth chip onto the tile, the L.A.M.A. DRAMA begins: The next player in turn still in the game must take all the chips from the L.A.M.A. DRAMA tile – unless this player also plays a L.A.M.A. card, possibly placing one more chip onto the tile. In this case, the next player in turn must take all the chips from the L.A.M.A. DRAMA tile – unless this player also plays a L.A.M.A. card, and so on.

If the round ends without any player taking the chips, the chips remain on the L.A.M.A. DRAMA tile for the next round. If the new round starts with five or more chips already on the tile, the L.A.M.A. DRAMA only restarts when a player plays yet another L.A.M.A. card, possibly placing one more chip onto the tile.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Space Wolves
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplemento – Space Wolves
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex-Ergänzung – Space Wolves
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Suplemento de Códex – Space Wolves
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Supplément de Codex – Space Wolves
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): コデックス・サプリメント：スペースウルフ
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): 圣典补充版 – 太空野狼
boardgame.description:
The Space Wolves are a savage Space Marine Chapter of merciless hunters. They hail from the icy death world of Fenris and strive to emulate the strength, cunning and howling ferocity of their Primarch – Leman Russ, the Wolf King. In their pursuit of the enemies of Mankind across the Sea of Stars, the Space Wolves employ the advanced technology and deadly weapons of the Adeptus Astartes under a skin of seemingly feral barbarity. The armoured flanks of their battle tanks are inscribed with runic totems. In the glare of plasma coils glint the fangs of primitive fetishes and over power armour the colour of threatening storms are hung the pelts of alpha predators. Alongside them lope the giant wolves of their home world, and the Space Wolves take up their loud howls when the warriors' keen senses detect their quarry at last run to ground. With audacious boasts, the taking of impetuous risks and the joyful roars of warriors born, the Space Wolves are a Chapter of heroes who wage war without fear or doubt, each seeking to forge a saga worthy of immortalisation.

Inside this 88-page hardback codex, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Space Wolves in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection, including:

The history of the Space Wolves, with a look at how they relentlessly take the fight to the enemies of the Allfather across the Sea of Stars
A Space Wolves bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
Rules for Space Marines units that are uniquely available to the Space Wolves
Rules for Sagas – a unique form of Warlord Traits – and how the mighty heroes of the Chapter can inspire their battle-brothers by performing the Deeds associated with them
Stratagems, the bespoke Tempestas psychic discipline, Relics of the Fang, and optional secondary objectives that define the ways that the Space Wolves wage war
Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics that are unique to the Space Wolves
And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the rules included in this codex.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Deathwatch
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplemento – Deathwatch
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex-Ergänzung – Deathwatch
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Suplemento de Códex – Deathwatch
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Supplément de Codex – Deathwatch
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): コデックス・サプリメント – デスウォッチ
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): 圣典补充版 – 死亡守望
boardgame.description:
The Deathwatch are a widespread Chapter of Space Marines and the Imperium's greatest weapon against the manifold threats posed by countless xenos races. From their hidden bases in orbiting watch fortresses, the Deathwatch despatch carefully selected operatives to hunt down and exterminate alien presences wherever they may be found. Each of these post-human warriors is a veteran of countless battles, tithed by their original Chapter to undertake the Long Vigil with the Deathwatch, guarding against alien incursion. Only the most skilled of xenos-hunters are afforded this honour and, amongst their new battle-brothers, they learn tactics and strategies to slay a wide range of alien races. The Deathwatch are an elite force equipped with a variety of specialist ammunition types, unusual weapons and secret wargear developed to more efficiently cut down their scuttling enemies. They are black-armoured hunters, filled with a righteous detestation for the xenos, and will not rest until the stain of the alien is scoured from the Galaxy.

Inside this 64-page hardback codex, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Deathwatch in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

The history of the Deathwatch, with a look at how they guard the Imperium against every alien threat – from without and within
A Deathwatch bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
Rules for Space Marines units that are uniquely available to the Deathwatch
Rules for fielding mixed units and Kill Teams with different specialisations
Stratagems, Warlord Traits, the bespoke Xenopurge psychic discipline, Relics of the Deathwatch, and optional secondary objectives that define the ways that the Deathwatch wage war
Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics that are unique to the Deathwatch
And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the rules included in this codex.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gorrinada
boardgame.description:
Gorrinada is a tile-placement and die rolling game in which the players create their meadows to feed the pigs and move them to the slaughterhouse. The first to be fed enough will be the winner, but in every movement, one can spoil other players' game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: サメマン (Same-man)
boardgame.description:
サメマン (Same-man), meaning Shark-Man, is a hidden identity card game from Japan.

Using multiple-choice questions with 3 choices, try to deduce the identity of the Dolphins disguised as humans to smuggle themselves into our society. Presumably, there is no way for dolphins to know how we think and reach the right answer determined by majority vote! However,
if the Dolphins manages to guess the answer correctly, the human race is to be wiped out. If that happens, pray to our shark hero Same-man. They should be able to fight off the Dolphins.

人間の皮を被り社会に入り込んだイルカを三択問題で炙り出しましょう。イルカに人の心、つまり多数決の正解が分かるはずがないのです！しかし正解をイルカに当てられてしまった時には人類は全滅です。そんな時はサメのヒーローサメマンに祈りましょう。イルカを撃退してくれるはずです

boardgame.name: トポロメモリー２ (Topolomemory 2)
boardgame.description:
トポロメモリー２ (Topolomemory 2) is a stand-alone expansion to トポロメモリー (TOPOLOMEMORY). It follows the same gameplay but introduces more complexity to the shapes. The game also has an improved quality cardstock. It can be played alone, or mixed in with Topolomemory, and/or Topolomemory 3.

トポロメモリー (TOPOLOMEMORY) is a Japanese card game based on the traditional matching game Karuta.

Topolomemory is a concentration game in which you have to match shapes using the principles of Topology. In it's basic form, topology shows us that a doughnut is the same as a coffee mug.

Lay out the tiles with various images on them and whoever most quickly identifies pairs that match topologically gets to collect the pair. The player with the most pairs wins the game. The game game be played by more than five players, especially in teams.
User summary

boardgame.name: Door Door
boardgame.description:
Door Door[a] is a 1983 single-screen platform video game developed and published by Enix in Japan. Originally released for the NEC PC-8801, it was ported to a number of other platforms, including the Family Computer. Controlling a small character named Chun, the player is tasked with completing each stage by trapping different kinds of aliens behind sliding doors. Chun can jump over the aliens and climb ladders, and must also avoid obstacles such as large nails and bombs.

Door Door was designed by Koichi Nakamura, known as the creator of Dragon Quest, as part of a programming contest held by Enix in the early 1980s. Winning first prize, Enix was given the rights to the game and ported the game to several Japanese home computers. Chun, the name of the protagonist, was a nickname given to Nakamura by one of his friends. Door Door was a critical and commercial success— the PC-8801 port alone had sold 200,000 copies, and is considered a classic title for the Famicom.[

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Door_Door Door Door]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Battle of Qingshuping
boardgame.description: The first issue of Mini Wargame Magazine. Attached is a wargame that simulates the Battle of Qingshuping（青树坪战役） during the Second Chinese Civil War.

boardgame.name: Prey of the Black Wolf
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A killer stalks the night and must be caught before he kills again!

Ravenloft: Prey of the Black Wolf expands upon the village of Kellee and the domain of

Tepest, which are the setting for this manhunt mystery adventure. A highwayman turned

Murderer named Elgin the Wolf, menaces all eastern Tepest. As the boneyard fills up with his

victims, the Reeve of Kellee becomes desperate to stop the killing spree. He puts out a call for

brave adventurers to track down and bring in Elgin, to face justice. Will you answer the call?

Can you catch the wolf before he kills again?

Ravenloft: Prey of the Black Wolf is an adventure for 4 to 6 1st to 3rd level charters that should take 1 to 3 game sessions to complete.

This adventure/campaign expansion features:


The 70-page adventure Ravenloft: Prey of the Black Wolf.



4 monsters that are new to 5th Edition D&D.



50 new NPCs for PCs to meet.



5 Pre-generated PCs that allow your group to jump right into the game!



21 new. full size maps, including area maps like the map of the Northern Core Lands or the village of Kellee, and battle maps battle maps like the sewer or road encounter maps.



New high-quality art throughout!

boardgame.name: Banana
boardgame.description:
The player controls a mole which digs through dirt collecting various fruits and vegetables. In most stages, the produce must be collected in a specific order, or the player may become stuck and be forced to restart the stage. During the stages, the player must also retrieve a female mole, referred to in the instruction manual as the player's daughter-in-law. When all objectives are complete, the player must leave through the exit. If the player dies, the character says something along the lines of "I'm beat."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Banana_%28video_game%29 Banana (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Seikima II Akuma no Gyakushū!
boardgame.description:
The game is based on a then-popular Japanese heavy metal band formed by Damian Hamada called Seikima-II. This band lasted from its creation in 1982 to its dissolution on December 31, 1999. Their history, as it has been prophesied, is that they are a group of demons preaching a religion in order to propagate Satan through the use of Heavy Metal. Each member is a demon of a different hierarchical class with His Excellency Demon Kogure being leader of demons and His Majesty Damian Hamada being crown prince of hell. In accordance to the prophecy and after completing the world conquest, the band would disband at the end of the century on December 12, 1999 at 23:59:59 Japan Standard Time (09:59:99 Eastern Standard Time).

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seikima_II_Akuma_no_Gyakush%C5%AB%21 Seikima II Akuma no Gyakushū!]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Kero Kero Keroppi no Daibouken 2: Donuts Ike ha Oosawagi
boardgame.description:
Kero Kero Keroppi no Daibouken 2: Donuts Ike ha Oosawagi (けろけろけろっぴの大冒険2 （ドーナツ池はおおさわぎ！！）) is a Japan-exclusive action video game video game for children that was released on the Family Computer console in 1993.

This video game has Sanrio's character searching for lost children who have been kidnapped by monsters. Essentially a standard Super Mario Bros. clone, the player controlling the cartoon frog has to leap around platforms jumping on baddies or killing them with his croak weapon. Each bonus level involves matching characters from the Sanrio franchise in a format similar to the card game Concentration. Intermission screens show the progress of the character throughout the game.

Levels range from the forest to a seaside setting.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kero_Kero_Keroppi_no_Daibouken_%28series%29%23Kero_Kero_Keroppi_no_Daibouken_2%3A_Donuts_Ike_ha_Oosawagi Kero Kero Keroppi no Daibouken (series)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.description:
Aquilus
OSR RPG Zine
Spring 2020
Issue Number 01

Ideas for use with traditional role-playing games & their modern editions

boardgame.name: Acts of Malice Volume One
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome back to Malice. Although our first impression of Malice suggests a cold Scandinavian town under snow-covered conditions, this is not always the case. Malice is more than just a town, it's a feeling of dread and isolation that permeates the mind and heart, along with a chill across the soul.

boardgame.name: Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden: Donty Monn promo card
boardgame.description:
Promo neighbor for the KS campaign "Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden returns!" (2020)
Donty Monn …is the self-proclaimed Village garden expert and always knows just what goes where.
Donty's transplant ability will cause the card with the highest Vegetable number to be replaced with a card previously discarded.

boardgame.name: Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden: Leticia Colewort promo card
boardgame.description:
Promo neighbor for the KS campaign "Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden returns!" (2020)

Leticia Colewort ...loves to house sit for her neighbours, she also loves looking in their closets and drawers.
Leticia will actually cause one of the Neighbours not used in the current game to visit Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden!

boardgame.name: The Adventurer's Tale
boardgame.description:
A solitaire push-your-luck roll & write game of dungeon design. Designed for the 5th Roll and Write Game Design Contest.

You must design a dungeon for an adventurer. Your aim is for the adventurer to survive to tell the tale, and for the tale to be worth the telling. Pack the dungeon with as many walls, treasures, potions, traps and monsters as you can get away with, but don't block the exit or kill the adventurer!

Roll 4 dice and use them to assign walls, a treasure, a monster, or occasionally a trap or potion to a location on the map. You may use shields to modify the dice rolls. But if you push your luck too far, you may end up creating rock falls and blocking the adventurer from reaching the exit.

A gamesheet is provided, but the game may also be played on squared paper. Multiple players may play simultaneously by using shared dice rolls.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rune: Adepts Micro Expansion
boardgame.description:
Recruit an adept to help you with the summoning.
Borrow his power and claim your victory!

At the beginning of the game, choose which of the two Adepts you want to play with. Their abilities will allow you to have an extra card in your hands or place a card ignoring placement rules.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Whispers & Rumors (Issue 6, Fall 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue, authors Michael Azzolino, Clinton Boomer, Tim Hitchcock, Jaye Sonia, and George "Loki" Williams bring you a series of short articles that expand the lore and world of Bloodlines & Black Magic. These include:

Game Launch- Author Jaye Sonia discusses the launch of the new edition of Bloodlines & Black Magic.

Invisible Locations: Gris Gris - Award-winning game designer and NO tour guide takes readers back into the invisible heart of New Orleans and one of its open secrets. When the outsiders go out to eat - Gris Gris is where they go.

Describing the Invisible World- Author Jaye Sonia addresses patterns and describing the Invisible World.

What is Attunement?- Author Jaye Sonia briefly describes how attunement works in Bloodlines & Black Magic.

The Redcap -This CR 3 Redcap gives Bloodlines & Black Magic (and 5e) game masters a dark, modern take on these foul fey.

Differing DCs - This short article describes how we use DCs in Bloodlines & Black Magic.

Small Towns or Big Cities - Where will you play?- This short article discusses play in rural, suburban, and urban environments.

The Seeker's Guide to Paranormal America - Developer Michael Azzolino gives you a look at one group's approach to the invisible world.

Serpents, Shadows, & Unholy Feats - A series of feats for the 1st-edition of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: Guess in 10: Animal Planet
boardgame.description:
EXCITING CARD GAME OF QUESTIONS - Ask up to 10 questions to guess the animal on the Game Card! Is it a carnivore? Is it a domestic animal? Does it live in groups? Think hard, ask intelligent questions, use your clue cards wisely, and the be the first player to win 7 Game Cards!

SUPER FUN FAMILY GAME - Perfect parental tool to approach playtime and family time. Discover 52 land, aquatic, wild and domestic animals with this game that can be enjoyed by all ages! Not only does it help children learn about animal characteristics in the most fun way possible but keeps even the smartest child engaged throughout the game!

PLAY IT ANY TIME ANY PLACE - One game set includes 52 Game Cards, 6 Clue Cards and a handy box to store it all. The box size is portable & travel friendly. Your child can become an instant champion by playing at family game night, gatherings, plane trips and more!

PERFECT GIFT FOR KIDS - Age appropriate content and gameplay that focus on building key skills in young learners.This game is for 2-6 Players.

HAPPY KIDS - Skillmatics Guess in 10 Games ensure kids have fun, learn key concepts and bond with their friends, siblings and family!

description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sagrada: Replacement Dice
boardgame.description: Official replacement dice from the makers of Sagrada. This package of 10 dice contains 2 dice in each of the 5 base game colors: red, blue, yellow, green, purple.

boardgame.name: NomadSed
boardgame.description:
NomadSed is a strategic board game where players assume the role of nomadic herders and try to increase their livestock capital. They have to make decisions that do not only depend on the state of the pastures, but also on daily challenges related to life in the steppe. At times, it makes sense to invest money and buy extra fodder; at others, sheep have to be sold at the market; and sometimes, cooperating with your neighbours is the best choice.

The players’ goal is to obtain as many animals and as much cash as possible. In the end, it will be seen whether this is best achieved by exploiting the lands or through considerate resource utilisation.

The players possess livestock herds, monetary resources, rangelands, and their own labour force which is expressed in action points. Not all pastures on the board are equally productive: fertile grasslands, as well as barren steppes, provide the dietary staples for the animals, and both are easily exhausted. Herd mobility is therefore vital.
Moreover, the players have various options for action so they can persist in the face of external adversities and prevail against the others. At the market, they may buy fodder, sell part of their livestock, or purchase additional animals. Development cards open up new options and alternative income sources.

The challenges faced by nomads are considerable. Year after year, they have to cope with different types of unexpected events. Recurrent external influences, whether local (drought, snowstorms, illness, legislation) or global in nature (price increases in animal fodder), determine their scopes of action. Only those who are flexible enough will prevail in the world of NomadSed.

NomadSed is entertaining and instructive all at once. Current problems that are faced by nomadic societies across the globe have been adapted into a game which offers insights into a unique subject matter. It has successfully been used in schools and universities to delve into the complex social-ecological conditions of land use in drylands.
The board game can be borrowed for educational purposes in an easily transportable version whose design has been registered.
The game was jointly developed in the context of the DFG-funded Collaborative Research Centre 586 ‘Difference and Integration’ in cooperation between the Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research – UFZ Leipzig, the University of Leipzig, and the Berlin University of the Arts.

boardgame.name: Ábrándos bárányok
Dulces Sueños
Insomnia
Sheepy Time
쉬피타임
boardgame.description:
You are one of the Dream Sheep, the sheep that people count in order to drift off to Dreamland! Each time you jump the fence, you help your person fall asleep easier — but the Nightmares that haunt these dreams threaten a rude awakening...

On a turn in Sheepy Time, you play one of two cards in your hand to move around the circle, potentially activating neat effects, while jumping the fence each time you complete a lap to put yourself in position to earn more points. When refilling your hand, however, if you draw a Nightmare card, you have to activate the Nightmare — and if it crosses your path, your human may be scared awake, which means you'll earn no points this round. How far do you dare push your Zzzs to prove you're the dreamiest sheep of all!

—description from the publisher

Cardboard Time Episode 5: Dune Imperium, Bonfire, Viscounts of the West Kingdom, Top 12 "New to me" of 2020.

boardgame.name: Skeletal Creatures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment will cover new undead creatures known as Skeletal Lord, Skeletal Orc, Skeletal Wolf, Skeletal Wraith. All these undead creatures can easily be the death of even the heartiest adventures.

boardgame.name: The Island of the Dead Sand
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Returning from a dangerous mission in Britannia coming back to Rome, the Custodes are embarked as passengers on the Naukleros, a Greek ship headed to Carthago Nova, in Iberia, captain by some Demetrius. Departed from Londinium, the Naukleros travels smoothly for twenty days along the Iberian coasts, but one night, right before passing the Pillars of Hercules, it is caught in a most violent storm...

At the edges of the Empire nobody can hear you scream!

Lex Arcana is an Historical-Fantasy Roleplaying in a Roman Empire That Never Fell

In Lex Arcana, you are a Custos (warden) of the Cohors Auxiliaria Arcana, sent by the Emperor to the four corners of the world to further the study of arcane lore, investigate forbidden cults, and face the thread posed by dangerous supernatural creatures.

This PDF contains:

A short and bloody adventure set near the Pillars of Hercules, the doors of the Mare Nostrum
Description of an horrible and ferocious new creature coming from an unknown territories
Fantastic artworks that can be used in your personal Lex Arcana sessions

boardgame.name: Kraken Corpse Delve
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everyone says the world is dying. Today you meet a stranger who has already seen it happen. She has traveled back through time to save the world…but only if you can save her!

An eldritch woman from the future begs you to save her from her sister, who wants to drag her back to her own time.

To close the time portal, you must climb down through the buried corpse of a kraken. The prize? A giant diamond worth 10,000 GP…if you can pull it out of the portal!

ADVENTURE TYPE: Exploration / One-Shot / Dungeon Delve / Low Level

boardgame.name: Journey to the Center of the Earth
Die Reise zum Mittelpunkt der Erde
Viaje al Centro de la Tierra
boardgame.description:
The prestigious professor of mineralogy Otto Lidenbrock and his nephew Axel discover a secret parchment scroll written by the alchemist Arne Saknussemm in the 15th century who reveals how to get to the center of the Earth.

They both travel to Iceland and there they hire the help of the hunter Hans with whom begin their descent through the Snæfellsjökull volcano towards the greatest adventure that human beings have ever known.

Players will draw a route from an entrance volcano to the center of the Earth and from there to one of the exit volcanoes. Each turn two cards are revealed: a coordinate card and a tunnel card (straight, curve, water springs, discoveries... or dangerous creatures). The players draw the tunnel card on a cell of the coordinate indicated.

When the tunnel deck runs out, players must consume one water point or they will be eliminated. When the coordinate deck runs out, one of the exit volcanoes will explode and cannot be used.

But you can always ask the protagonists of the novel for help to change the rules.

Live the unforgettable adventure created by Jules Verne!


El prestigioso profesor de mineralogía Otto Lidenbrock y su sobrino Axel descubren un pergamino secreto escrito por el alquimista Arne Saknussemm en el siglo XV que revela como llegar al centro de la Tierra. Ambos viajan hasta Islandia y allí contratan la ayuda del cazador Hans con el que emprenden el descenso por el volcán Snæfellsjökull hacia la mayor aventura que ha conocido el ser humano.

Los jugadores deberán trazar una ruta desde el volcán de entrada hasta el centro de la Tierra y de ahí hasta uno de los volcanes de salida. Cada turno se desvelan dos cartas: una carta de coordenada y otra carta de túnel (recta, curva, manantiales de agua, descubrimientos... o peligrosas criaturas). Los jugadores dibujan lo indicado en la carta de túnel en una casilla de la coordenada sacada.

Cuando el mazo de túnel se agote, los jugadores deben consumir un punto de agua o serán eliminados. Cuando el mazo de coordenadas se agote, uno de los volcanes de salida estallará y no podrá usarse.

Pero siempre se podrá pedir ayuda a los protagonistas de la novela para cambiar las reglas.

¡Vive la inolvidable aventura creada por Julio Verne!

boardgame.name: The Dream Prison
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original level 6-8 adventure made for D&D 5e.

The adventurers must travel to the Plane of Reverie and free an ancient heir to a dying kingdom from the Dream Prison. Along the way, the heroes must sail the Sleeping Rivers, defeat the threshold guardians, and unbind the prisoner from a sorcerous jail.

boardgame.name: Necromancer Class: Master of Death and Undeath
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Necromancer Class – Masters of Death and Undeath includes the following new additions to Labyrinth Lord:

Necromancer Class details;
Necromancer Spell List, including 23 new spells and modifications for four existing spell groups;
New necromantic magic items – bone armor, cloak of the necromancer, ghoul ring, ring of undead detection, staff of necromancy, wand of wounding, and the mighty vampire cape!
Three new lower order demons for necromancers to summon and heroes to slay.

boardgame.name: Supertall: Wrecktar Returns
boardgame.description:
Wrecktar is breaking free of Sprawlopolis and making its way UP the buildings of Supertall. This one card expansion puts some monster-sized pressure on your opponents.

Scoring: If this tower matches the City Hall plan type, score 5 points. Otherwise, score none for this tower.


Released in the November 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

boardgame.name: Shroudhaven (2.0 - PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nestled in a deep valley, sunlight has never caressed centuried Shroudhaven. Thick fog—rendered permanent by ancient magics—fills the valley. Here, refugees from a long-forgotten war found sanctuary from their enemies. Most villagers are undead, and a dark reputation hangs over the village. Visitors to the village, though, tell a different story. They speak of the undead battling their basest urges and trying to live peaceful lives.

boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

boardgame.name: The Storm's Impending Rage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Goblins are pillaging farmsteads; bandits are attacking caravans; and Baron Wrymslayer’s forces are already stretched too thin. A call to arms has been issued for the brave and the cunning to rid this upstart Baron’s lands of these villains and sons of darkness.

The Storm's Impending Rage is a sandbox adventure for starting characters, levels 1-3, though there are many places in the area where low level characters can find themselves in over their heads.! It is the first adventure in the Upon the Face of the Deep campaign, a loosely connected collection of advetures set against the backdrop of the rise of the New Cult of the Old Gods.

The Storm's Impending Rage is set in the Rosewood Highlands near the Free City of Jacob's Well, and the adventure uses Swords & Wizards in the Highlands, an S&W rules variant (not yet available) but it is fully compatible with most Old School rulesets based on the World's First Fantasy Roleplaying Game.
boardgame.rpgseries: Upon the Face of the Deep

boardgame.name: Cat's Cradle Town Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cat’s Cradle stands at the intersection of a caravan and river route, which brings in mysterious travelers, unscrupulous grifters, and -- quite often -- dangerous villains.

A Place of Dangers and Opportunities

A walled town of roughly 4000 citizens, Cat’s Cradle is a modular resource that can be used any time you need a town at the intersection of trade routes. This book describes the important locations in the town and its immediate surroundings, such as the “salt” mines formed by the ancient intersection of some massive interplanar beast with the material plane. The otherworldly mineral deposits left behind are used in Cat’s Cradle’s thriving alchemy-related businesses.

boardgame.name: The Grey Citadel: Temple of the Azure Eye (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Temple of the Azure Eye is a short lair-based adventure to be used in conjunction with the adventure module The Grey Citadel by Nathan Douglas Paul, available from Frog God Games.

The sleepy little community of Glitterburn Glen is so named because of the myriad of flakes of mica in the brook that babbles softly between the farms on its way to join the rushing River Eamon. The name itself should be a clue to the nature of the mineral deposits in the hills, where numerous springs feed the year-round fl ow of the brook. The farmers that live there are simple folk, and they have only one common building — a stone homestead that was willed to the collective ownership of the community — to call a public house. There, they gather in the evenings to chat, mend, and pass jugs of home-brewed mead and cider. No money is exchanged, and everyone brings what he or she can afford to toss in the stew pot, or a song and a tall tale. They are typical of the hardy, self-sufficient folk of Eamonvale, but they are completely unaware of the dangerous creature that dwells just beyond their grazing flocks.

boardgame.name: The Grey Citadel (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure in the Grey Citadel of Dun Eamon
In the city of Dun Eamon, demons roam the streets, criminals rule the night and an important local power figure has gone missing. Can your heroes unravel the clues that lead through every social element of the city–from the heights of the Grey Citadel to far below its streets and even into the hearts of its inhabitants? Or are some mysteries better left unsolved?

Uncover An Artifact of Great Evil
The Grey Citadel is a mini-campaign of urban detective work and dungeon exploration designed for four or more characters of 5th level. Set in a rain-soaked, rough-and-tumble frontier city. The Grey Citadel offers numerous colorful NPCs, a richly unique location, new monsters, and magic items — plus enough plot twitsts to provide hours of role-playing and door-kicking adventure, where your wits must be as sharp as your swords.

boardgame.name: Strange New World Gazetteer Volume I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange New World is an OSR-compatible campaign setting set during the colonization era of North America (1600/1700's era) but set in a world where magic, monsters and, more importantly, strangeness have returned to the new world. Soldiers and monster hunters fight side by side trailblazers and mountaineers. Witches weave terrible magics while preachers vanquish chaos and shepherd the people.

boardgame.name: The Grey Citadel (PF)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the city of Dun Eamon, demons roam the streets, criminals rule the night and an important local power figure has gone missing. boardgame.name: Monty Haul (V1 #0 - Mar 2020)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

It's the Official "Proof of Concept" Issue, featuring:
- The Obligatory "Get to Know Me" Essay!
- New Cleric Domains and New Backgrounds
- The Divine Archeologist: A Thief Specialization!
- New Options for Familiars & Critical Hits!
- A Noble House Family Generator!

boardgame.name: Abstrakto
boardgame.description:
A two-player strategic game designed by Néstor Romeral Andrés and José Manuel Astilleros García-Monge.

Abstrakto is a game of territorial occupation in which players try to claim territory on the board by closing off empty areas with three different types of tiles (“Solid”, “Line”, and “Cross”) according to simple placement rules. A closed area is conquered by the player with most tiles surrounding it.

COMPONENTS

• A 7 × 7 square board
• 18 blue tiles (6 of each type)
• 18 orange tiles (6 of each type)
• 25 scoring markers (10 blue and 10 orange and 5 grey)

“Solid” tiles can only be placed inside the board cells.

“Line” tiles can only be placed centered on the edges of the board cells, including the edge of the board.

“Cross” tiles can only be placed on the lines’ intersections, excluding the edge and the corner of the board (in those places, the tile’s lines would extend beyond the underlying gridlines of the cell borders).

boardgame.name: Hideo's World
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A One Shot for the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror RPG.

Genius inventor Hideo Kieslowski has been trapped in his own virtual slickworld for more than a decade and now his once-glorious abandoned dreamland is crumbling. Can you rescue Hideo before his permasleep becomes permadeath?

boardgame.name: Mousquetaires du Roy: Promo cards and board
boardgame.description:
Published in Ystari magazine issue 1 (February 2011, p. 18).

Three new cards: De Bar (minion card), La Poursuite (trap card)
Larcin (treachery card).

New board:
Each Musketeer can challenge Milady once in the game to win a bonus. This challenge can be launched from anywhere and costs one action.

boardgame.name: For the Dungeon!
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

For the Dungeon! is a comedy role-playing game where you get to play as the hapless minions instead of the heroes. Experience the rush of unquestioning loyalty to a darker power and charging into danger with reckless abandon! Raid villages, scout ancient ruins for artifacts, and protect the dungeon from homicidal adventurers.

Instead of a well established world, the game uses principles taken from Powered by the Apocalypse style games and improv comedy to create the setting. For the Dungeon! relies heavily on player created prompts that are interpreted by the Game Master to reveal the details of the world.

The game is designed to be fast-paced, with a focus on creating memorable moments. Because the game is light and has a greater focus on the story, anybody can pick up and play with minimal effort. The fun is created more through the unexpected scenarios the players get themselves into than by studying rules.

boardgame.name: Thief King's Vault (S&W)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It has long been said there no thieves in the city of Caltoshar.

At night, one can safely walk the streets, and a few worry about locking their doors. Yet one would be foolish to believe Caltoshar is without a criminal element, for there are thieves aplenty if one knows where to look. The best advice would be for you to assuage you curiosity with such matters, and enjoy Caltoshar for what it appears to be.

You’re probably not one to take wise counsel, though.

The Thief King’s Vault is a short adventure for six 5th-level characters.

boardgame.name: Thief King's Vault (PF)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It has long been said there no thieves in the city of Caltoshar.

At night, one can safely walk the streets, and a few worry about locking their doors. Yet one would be foolish to believe Caltoshar is without a criminal element, for there are thieves aplenty if one knows where to look. You’re probably not one to take wise counsel, though.

The Thief King’s Vault is a short adventure for six 5th-level characters.

boardgame.name: Hall of the Rainbow Mage (PF)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While investigating the disappearance of Londar Brightrain, also known as the Rainbow Mage, the party comes across dark, twisted plans and deadly secrets before locating his famous treasures. Treasures found include several new spells along with a few magic items. Unfortunately, the traps and creatures left behind by Londar hamper the party’s investigation and other adventurers compete for his famous secrets and treasures.

boardgame.name: Hall of the Rainbow Mage (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While investigating the disappearance of Londar Brightrain, also known as the Rainbow Mage, the party comes across dark, twisted plans and deadly secrets before locating his famous treasures. Treasures found include several new spells along with a few magic items. Unfortunately, the traps and creatures left behind by Londar hamper the party’s investigation and other adventurers compete for his famous secrets and treasures.

boardgame.name: Bots & Pieces
boardgame.description:
Meet Tartarus, your new home - a trash-moon orbiting a stellar black hole.

Control an Urfling robot, defeating crazed cultists, giant worms, A.I kill-bots, or multidimensional creatures. Discover the mysterious Corrosion Zone, Great Compactor cult, the compelling Tartareans, or the Tellurian's underground cities.
Access an imaginative mechanic, Linking, create multi-characters that combine actions and learn exclusive skills. Gain creative control over characters through naming skills, build/upgrade characteristics, construct Pieces, etc.

Control your Stress or face character retirement.

Effortlessly create games using a point-based system. Build Challenges and Encounters, construct nail-biting gameplay experiences.

Players build dice pools using their Skills as keywords in describing their actions against challenges.


Publisher Blurb*

boardgame.name: Hall of the Rainbow Mage (S&W)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While investigating the disappearance of Londar Brightrain, also known as the Rainbow Mage, the party comes across dark, twisted plans and deadly secrets before locating his famous treasures. Treasures found include several new spells along with a few magic items. Unfortunately, the traps and creatures left behind by Londar hamper the party’s investigation and other adventurers compete for his famous secrets and treasures.

boardgame.name: Garimundan Bane
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Garimundas is a garden world on the interstellar government frontier. It’s warm, inviting, with abundant flora…and a species of insect that’s among the deadliest in known space. Though only a few centimeters long, this creature has a unique ability: to enlist the aid of a vicious local predator in completing its reproductive cycle, benefiting both animals.

Lifeform Reading: Garimundan Bane is for 2D6 science fiction games such as Cepheus Engine and The Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG), although it’s usable with other systems with a little work.

boardgame.name: Crono's Guide to Time
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Rest is not idleness, and to lie sometimes on the grass under trees on a summer's day, listening to the murmur of the water, or watching the clouds float across the sky, is by no means a waste of time...

[This item] is a set of Variant Rules for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.

boardgame.name: Manual of Marine Magic, Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

18 nautical magic items for fastidious fishermen, seasick sailors, and plundering pirates.

boardgame.name: Mecis' Manual of Magix
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A collection of marvelous and mind-boggling magic items and monsters.

boardgame.name: Oathmark: Battlesworn
boardgame.description:
Oathmark: Battlesworn is a supplement for Oathmark: Battles of the Lost Age, giving players rules for creating elite units of warriors known as "battlesworn" and charting their progress from battle-to-battle.

In the horror and chaos of battle, the outcome can often hang on the briefest of moments. It is at these times that the actions of one unit can make the difference between victory and defeat. Wise kings know this and realize that it is often prudent to hold back their best units until they can make the greatest difference. These elite units, called the "battlesworn", are more than just powerful combatants, they are symbols of the glory and honor of a kingdom. All young warriors hope to one day join their ranks and add their oathmarks beside those legendary fighters.

This supplement for Oathmark: Battles of the Lost Age contains rules for adding elite units to your armies and charting their progress from battle to battle. Will they grow even more powerful as they gain renown, or be broken in the face of tremendous odds, perhaps someday to be reformed when their kingdom needs them most? Also included are rules for rivers and boats as well as campaigns, featuring all-new scenarios that will give your battlesworn the chance to lead their kingdom to new heights of power and prestige.
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Oathmark Battlesworn
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Oathmark: Battles of the Lost Age

boardgame.name: Frostgrave: Second Edition – The Red King
boardgame.description:
Fires rage throughout the Frozen City as an inhuman army pours out of the cracks between realities. In the distant past, a cabal of city elders sought to save their lives by making a pact with a demon prince...and now the Red King has come to collect what he is owed, claiming Frostgrave as his own. Many have already fled before the Red King's demonic hordes, while others seek to weather the storm, turning their bases into makeshift fortresses. The wizards of Frostgrave must choose: Do they stand and fight, or do they abandon this great repository of mystical knowledge to the ravages of unearthly fire?

Frostgrave: The Red King is the first supplement designed for Frostgrave: Second Edition. In this sprawling, epic campaign, wizards will be pushed to their limits, fighting not only against one another and the perils of the Frozen City, but also against an invading army. As the Red King's power grows, the laws of magic and nature will start to bend. Can the wizards put aside their differences long enough to oppose this common foe, or will greed and mistrust doom them all?

Title: Frostgrave: The Red King Publisher: Osprey Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Inkling
boardgame.description:
Splashes of dark ink on a blank page, the characters illegible — or are they? The line that seemed like a scribble, could it perhaps be the letter N, or is it a Z on its side? And that circle, is it an O or a Q, or maybe part of a B? You can't know for sure, but you might have an inkling...

Inkling is a word game for 3-6 players with an innovative twist. Each turn, you play your letter cards in front of you, hoping the players next to you can glean the words you're trying to convey — but without the perfect letters you will need to get creative! How you go about that is up to you: rotate your cards, play them upside down or on their side, or have them overlap one another. Whatever it takes to get your meaning across...

2021 UK Games Expo Best Party Game Nominee

boardgame.name: In Cold Storage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to five characters of levels 6-7

Pruina, a frost giant battle-sorceress, has big plans. Aiding her oafish jarl to best the fools who challenge him grew tiresome ages ago, so after striking a deal with a stone giant druid south of her home, she established a hidden base in these caves.

Marplott, a gnome mage, heard rumors of “giants and guardians” and decided to investigate – or interfere. Despite his experience, Marplott is now stuck in the caverns; he’d appreciate being rescued.

boardgame.name: Ancient Warfare Army Lists suitable for Fast Play Rules & Big Battles
boardgame.description:
"The Army Lists in this booklet have primarily been compiled for use with the Fast Play Ancient Warfare Rules published by Newbury Rules. They may also be used in conjunction with other rules including our own 'Warfare in the Ancient World', though some amendment of the troop descriptions and figure points values will be required. The novel format of the Lists is designed to enable the player to devise his model army quickly and simply whilst ensuring a realistic balance of the component troop types, this is of course in keeping with the concept of the Fast Play Rules themselves." - Ancient Warfare Army Lists suitable for Fast Play Rules & Big Battles, R. G. Boss & T. J. Halsall, Newbury Rules, 1985, p.1

Additional section (pages 35-36) on converting these lists for other rules, in particular WRG War Games Rules 3000 BC to 1485 AD, 6th Edition.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Fast Play Rules for Ancient Warfare

boardgame.name: Micro Chapbook Co-Op
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Micro Chapbook Co-Op is a set of add-on rules for the Micro Chapbook RPG system. The basic system is designed for simplicity, quickness of play, and ease of entry. It is ultimately a solo game . . . until now.

All of the game books so far include a few tips for playing co-op, but these co-op rules give you more clear and precise guidelines to play this game and all of its adventure books with a group of players. NO GAME MASTER NEEDED!

boardgame.name: Micro Chapbook Tactics
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Tactical combat rules for use with the Micro Chapbook RPG.
...
Micro Chapbook Tactics is a set of add-on rules for the Micro Chapbook RPG system. While the basic system is designed for simplicity, quickness of play, and ease of entry, some players might desire more from their solo RPG.

These tactical rules enhance the combat experience already present in the game by introducing a map-based tactical system that utilizes miniatures. Much of combat works the same as before, but now with the addition of movement and character placement.

boardgame.name: What History Leaves Behind
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Inquisition of the Radiant Dawn has come across an opportunity that no one would have thought possible. In one of the ruins of Thultanthar spread across the Cormanthor lies an ancient text that will be key to the Inquisition’s future success, and only you can be trusted to find it. A Two/Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

It is highly suggested that the DM have familiarity with the WYC 1 Series as this is a direct continuation of that story.

boardgame.name: A Shard of Shar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Miriam, a priestess of Amunator has received a message from an acquaintance in Mulmaster that she has something dark in her possession that can only be trusted with the Inquisition of the Radiant Dawn and you are the only ones she can trust. A Two/Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

It is highly suggested that the DM have familiarity with the WYC 1 Series as this is a direct continuation of that story.

boardgame.name: The Light of Heresy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The priestess Miriam seeks a collection of artifacts to enhance the power of her Inquisition. She offers a reward to adventurers who can retrieve the first, the Sun Disk of Aumunator. There’s one catch – she isn’t sure where it can be found. A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters with two one-hour bonus objectives. Optimized for APL 8.

It is highly suggested that the DM have familiarity with the WYC 1 Series as this is a direct continuation of that story.

boardgame.name: The Ballad of Naoki and Koa
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The hottest music act in the Moonsea region, Duke Monsoon and the Waves are traveling to Phlan to headline the Reclamation Day festival. The caravan is in need of extra security and you need a job. All you have to do is ensure Duke Monsoon makes it to the gig on time. What could possibly go wrong?

A Two Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

boardgame.name: A Bridge to Thar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The adventurers volunteer for an urgent mission to raid a cultist group disguised as a merchant caravan that's transporting tribute and slaves to forge an alliance with savage orcs.

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

boardgame.name: Oh My Gourd!
boardgame.description:
Grow a giant gourd with the help of your gardening tools and a Lucky Ladybug, but watch out! Clever critters, mean Mr. Frost, and big bad weeds will keep your gourd from growing. Protect your garden from unwanted guests and give it everything a growing gourd needs to win!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: In Accordance with Plans
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

One Hell of an Issue to Tackle

A glorious city rises against a landscape of urban decay and ruin, attracting the desperate and those that prey upon them. All will conform to the architect’s vision.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

User summary:

This scenario uses materials contained in DDAL00-11: Pipyap's Guide to All of the Nine Hells.

boardgame.name: A Hell of a Party
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Hell of a Good(ish) Time

A powerful devil is organizing a dark alliance that would have long-reaching consequences if left unchecked. Brave heroes, as well as cunning troublemakers, are needed to crash this fiendish gathering.

A Four-/Six Hour Adventure of Social Intrigue and Daring Heists for Tier 2 Characters.

Optimized for APL 8.

User summary:

This scenario uses materials contained in DDAL00-11: Pipyap's Guide to All of the Nine Hells.

boardgame.name: A Hellish Haul
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Problem of Hellish Proportions

A fiendish proposition offers heroes a way home but relies upon a task so torturous that it pushes their loyalty, greed and sanity to their limits! Can adventurers endure the hellish haul or will their hopes sink into the fetid fens of an endless bog?

A Two-/Four-Hour Tier One D&D Adventure set in Minauros and optimized for APL 3.

User summary:

This scenario uses materials contained in DDAL00-11: Pipyap's Guide to All of the Nine Hells.

boardgame.name: Two Empires
boardgame.description:
Two rival civilizations clash as they expand their borders and vie for control of important territories. You must lead your people to victory, as only one empire is destined to rule the land.

Two Empires is a two-player area control and card placement game using a deck of 18 identical cards. In the game each player will take on the role of either the Red Overlord or the Blue Emperor. You will make key decisions on where to put cards on the map in order to lead your people's growth from tribal villages into a vast empire. Players will score points for Cities, Provinces, and Mines. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Magneto & Toad
boardgame.description:
Max Eisenhardt, the man who would become Magneto, faced unimaginable discrimination and evil during the Third Reich’s rise to power in World War II. He survived, thanks in part to the manifestation of his mutant power to control magnetic fields. Following the war, he resolved that such a fate would never befall mutant kind. An uncompromising freedom fighter for his fellow mutants, his extreme beliefs for mutant superiority drove a wedge between Magneto and his close friend, Professor Xavier. Magneto’s vision for mutant kind caused him to form the Brotherhood of Mutants, who fight for mutant supremacy.

Mortimer Toynbee, known as Toad, is a genetically flawed mutant. Visibly mutated since birth, he was abandoned by his parents to an orphanage where he was ostracized for his appearance. When Magneto discovered and recruited him, Toad embraced the mission to conquer the human race who had rejected and degraded him. Toad serves Magneto as an unquestioning lackey using his mutant abilities of enhanced jumping and prehensile tongue.

listing.notes: Title: Marvel: Crisis Protocol - Magneto & Toad Publisher: Atomic Mass Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Storm & Cyclops
boardgame.description:
Scott Summers is Cyclops, the first member of the mutant team theX-Men. Summers’ mutant power causes him to produce beams of optic force from his eyes. Unable to control these beams, Cyclops must wear protective ruby lenses to shield others from his mutant ability. As the field leader of theX-Men, Cyclops is a master tactician and skilled combatant who never stops fighting for equality between mutants and human kind.

Ororo Munroe descends from along line of witch-priestesses.Once worshipped as a goddess of the storm, she is a mutant with the ability to control the weather, able to produce hurricane winds and summon lightning at a whim. After a chance encounter with Professor Xavier, Munroe joined his task force, the X-Men. As a member of the X-Men, she is Storm, a capable leader and one of the most powerful mutants in existence.

listing.notes: Title: Marvel: Crisis Protocol - Cyclops & Storm Publisher: Atomic Mass Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Wolverine & Sabretooth
boardgame.description:
Wolverine is a man whose past is shrouded in mystery. His mutant power of enhanced regeneration not only protects him from harm but has dramatically increased his life span. It also made him the ideal subject for the Weapon X project, which bonded indestructible metal to his skeleton and claws while robbing him of his memory. As a member of the X-Men, Wolverine is a gruff and vicious member of the team who often clashes with the team’s leader, Cyclops.

The mutant Victor Creed, called Sabertooth by many, is a feral assassin and mercenary. His mutant abilities grant him an enhanced healing rate, keen senses, and razor-sharp claws he uses to savage his foes. He is a long-time enemy ofWolverine. Their pasts intertwine through decades of conflict, and Sabertooth acts as a dark mirror of Wolverine’s suppressed savage instincts.

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Mystique & Beast
boardgame.description:
Mystique is a peerless shapeshifter, able to alter her physical appearance and voice to match another person’s as a perfect mimic. Little is known about her early life, though she has claimed to be over 100 years old. During her life, she has assassinated several significant figures involved in mutant affairs, imitated high-ranking generals and politicians, and clashed with the X-Men on numerous occasions.

Dr. Hank McCoy is a founding member of the X-Men who possesses enhanced agility and genius-level intellect. McCoy has undergone progressive mutations that have increasingly given him a feral, bestial appearance, including fangs, claws, and superhuman senses. Though his visage is animalistic, Beast retains his intelligence and is a global authority on matters of mutant kind, a top-tier geneticist, and a fierce advocate for mutant rights.

boardgame.name: 果実の収穫 (The Fruit Harvest)
boardgame.description:
There is a mysterious apple orchard.
And the time for harvesting has once again arrived.  

Protect your orchard from insects and birds while taking care of your trees and harvesting your apples. Let’s gather as many apples as we can.

Each player tends to their own orchard and collects apples by strategically placing trees and apples.

On each turn, a player should lay down two cards (face up) from their hand to build their personal orchard. There are two types of cards: apples and trees. An orchard is made up a tree column and an apple column. Tree cards are played into the tree column to form a trunk. When the total value of the trunk is greater than or equal to 100, harvesting begins. If the trunk’s value is exactly 100, it is an abundant harvest and therefore the player may harvest all apples that they have placed into their apple column. If the value is greater than 100, the player may only harvest a single apple (the uppermost card aka the most recently placed card).

After harvesting, all tree cards are disposed and the player must work to grow another tree.

In addition, a player may also place down cards horizontally to achieve different effects.  

An apple card of the same number can be placed horizontally to create a “cluster” of fruit. If, for example, this cluster is at the top of the apple column and a player begins harvesting after going over 100 in value, the player will be able to collect all the apples in the cluster (instead of just a single apple). However, if a player harvests their apples upon fulfilling the exactly 100 value requirement, they will only be able to harvest up till the first cluster and not the whole column.  

A tree card of the same number as another tree card can also be placed horizontally to create a branch. After harvesting, the non-trunk cards of this branch do not need to be disposed and instead can be rearranged to form a new column as the new trunk.  

In addition, branches give the player the option to include or exclude the cards forming the branch in their total tree value count (towards 100).

Branches and clusters can only be continuously built on the uppermost card (aka most recently placed card) for the column.

In this game, you can also chose to help tend your neighbor’s orchard. You may play any card into their orchard instead of your own. If by doing this you fulfill the 100 value requirement for harvest, you will receive half of your neighbor’s apple cards (you chose which half). If you fulfill the over 100 value requirement instead, you will battle with your neighbor over the single apple/cluster card(s).

  Battling consists of playing a “war”-esque game where both players simultaneously reveal a card from their hand. The player with the higher value tree card will win the apple Card. (Except for in the case that the highest card is 50, which will then allow for a 5 card to win instead.)

  At the end of the game (when the drawing deck is empty), this battling comes back into play to decide who gets the remaining unharvested apples in everyone’s orchards.

There are also some special cards including a pigeon card, a woodpecker card, and a bug card which have different effects. Like apple and tree cards, players can choose to play them into their opponents’ orchards.

Randomly generated tower of trade.

boardgame.name: In the Thicket
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

A dice-drop adventure pamphlet.

With this pamphlet you can enter The Thicket, a roiling, roving, ever-changing, demi-sphere of plant-life. Grab a handful of dice and drop them on a piece of paper. Each die represents a location. The number rolled and shape of the die influence the look, vibe, and happenings there.

boardgame.name: Carnelian Riddle in the House of Indolent Blooms
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

You are commissioned to rob a Sphinx

Infiltrating his garden party

Meandering through a semi-hostile demiplane segregated from the flow of time

boardgame.name: Property of the Department of Doors
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

The Department of Doors is a Troika! pamphlet adventure mostly consisting of tables to help you generate an interesting adventure. Improvisation and interpretation by the GM required.

The Department of Doors (DoD) issues high-quality doors all over the city. An open secret is that every door issued by the department has a backdoor. A way for them to access the door from a centralized location. Walking through a door in DoD deep storage allows you to exit through its twin, wherever it is in the city.

The Department of Doors deep storage unit. Here each backdoor to department-issued doors is stored. Rails carry doors on hooks from one area to the next. Stacks of discarded or rarely used doors are seen everywhere. Sounds of what is happening behind the thousands of doors from all directions. It is a maze, many people, even DoD employees, have been known to get lost here.

You gained access to deep storage through a backdoor someone opened for you from inside the department and are standing in between thousands and thousands of doors. What are you here for and how does it go? Find out!

boardgame.name: The Calamitous Creation of the Guild of Mechanical Artistry
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

The Guild of Mechanised Artistry has lost control of their flagship creation, an enormous construction of metallurgy and sorcery intended to be something like a terrestrial cruise ship, an ambulatory hotel that takes wealthy guests on expansive tours of the outer wilds. It was due to be revealed at the annual Spherical Fete, a convention and exhibition where Guilds from across the Spheres gather to show off their creations, network, and get high together.

Alas, now the thing is trampling the city, and there’s very little to be done about it.

Enter the characters.

boardgame.name: The Milk Provider
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

A Pamphlet to Play a Quest for the Unicorn Milk.

boardgame.name: The 7th Annual Conference of Alchemists, Apothecaries, and Accountants
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

A Trade Conference Adventure Pamphlet.

boardgame.name: Creatures of Vathis, Volume One (5E)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

While we know that players will use these creatures in their own creative fashion and devise unique lore for them, we wanted to provide our readers with some context and share a few thematic hallmarks of the world from which they were born. On this page you can find some information about the world of Vathis, where Zodiac Empires is set. Happy gaming!

boardgame.name: Blockaded in Bahlgran
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Two years now the blockade has gone on. The disgraced Mime Liege holds onto a modicum of power.

User summary:

2-page scenario

boardgame.name: House Party
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

You have spent the whole night talking to the same people and now you really need to pee before you get the cab home. Only issue is the party has got pretty wild, and if you don't get out soon you might be roped into helping tidy up.

boardgame.name: Tracks
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

An adventure about hunting monsters and building cars from their parts.

boardgame.name: He Made the Trains Run on Time
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

A science fantasy hexcrawl.

boardgame.name: Panic on Pyramid Prime
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

A Pamphlet-PANIC!.

From the introduction:

Cacaphonic and chromatic chaos flourishes in the sky, as large negatively-charged triangle-shaped negatrons rain onto the inhabitants of Pyramid Prime.

boardgame.name: In High Dudgeon
boardgame.description:
From back of the book:

All is not well in the village of Low Dudgeon. For 10 years now, Low Dudgeon has consistently lost the annual midsummer games to its neighbour, High Dudgeon.

How can this be? High Dudgeon must be up to no good. Perhaps a sorcerer. Perhaps underhand tactics. Perhaps something in the water.

It is down to the intrepid adventurers to investigate, and get to the root of the matter before things turn ugly...

In High Dudgeon is a complete adventure for the Lyonesse roleplaying game, for 2-6 characters. The scenario includes all maps, encounters, non-player character details, and Games Master notes.

boardgame.name: Catan: Starfarers – Space Jump
Catan: Sternefahrer – Raumsprung
boardgame.description:
Do you dare to jump in space?

With the Catan: Starfarers – Space Jump promo encounter card, you expand your deck of cards in Catan: Starfarers and can now compare your friendship cards in order to jump through the galaxy with one of your spaceships.

boardgame.name: Infinity RPG Primer "Circular File"
boardgame.description:
From introduction:

This Quickstart provides content drawn from Corvus Belli’s Inﬁnity the Roleplaying Game, including an overview of the Human Sphere and a rules snapshot that can be readily ﬂexed with the accompanying mini-adventure.

• A summary of the future that is Inﬁ nity and the breath-taking technological advances that allow humanity to soar amongst the stars.
• An introduction to the popular 2d20 ruleset, including Heat, Momentum, task resolution, and more.
• A brief overview of the Wilderness of Mirrors — the shadowy political machinations that can be used to introduce intrigue and suspense to each mission.
• A free introductory adventure — Circular File — that thrusts the players into the midst of a tenuous situation aboard one of the massive Circulars that tour humanity’s systems.
• Six pre-generated characters drawn from across the Human Sphere, meaning GMs and players can dive straight into the action!

boardgame.name: カルマノルマ (Karman Norm)
boardgame.description:
The explosive population growth of human beings in modern times was caused by "insufficient extinguishing of the light of life" by the young Grim Reapers who still have to learn.
Again today, young Grim Reapers go out in the city in search of the "lights of life".

The players become Grim Reapers and want to blow the lights out of as many people as possible.
The game is played over a Day and Night phase. In the day phase the players try to collect as many matches (people) as possible and in the night phase the matches need to be blown out in order to score points.

In turn order each player plays a card from their hand and whoever played the highest card can go first and put down the card at any of the available locations. Then, the players check who has the majority in card values on each location and get matches or blow out matches according to what is printed on the location card.

At the end of the game blown out matches are worth 1 point, burning matches are worth -1 point. The player with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: AXIO: Duel Hexagonal
boardgame.description:
New duel variant for 2 players, with an additional duel board and 6 duel tokens.

How to play:

Setup: Instead of using individual score boards, place the duel board between the two players. Use only one set of counters, placing one counter of each colour on the dividing line in the middle of each track on the duel board.

Gameplay: Play as usual. When you score, advance the respective colour counters on the duel board in your direction. You cannot advance the counters beyond the final space (value 9) on your side of the duel board. For each counter that reaches the final space, call out “Axio” and place the corresponding duel token face up in front of you. Then you get an instant bonus play of one tile as usual.
